questions.question: What is the purpose of the `contenteditable` attribute in HTML?
options: It specifies whether the content of an element is editable by the user.
It defines the content type of a form element.
It enables styling for interactive elements.
It restricts access to the element's content.
questions.answer: It specifies whether the content of an element is editable by the user.

questions.question: How can you create a responsive design with the `<picture>` element?
options: By using multiple `<source>` elements with different media queries.
By setting a fixed width for images.
By using CSS styles.
By applying JavaScript to change images dynamically.
questions.answer: By using multiple `<source>` elements with different media queries.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the `<noscript>` tag?
options: To provide alternative content for users who have disabled JavaScript.
To hide elements from browsers that support JavaScript.
To define scripts that should not be executed.
To indicate deprecated HTML elements.
questions.answer: To provide alternative content for users who have disabled JavaScript.

questions.question: What does the `<base>` tag specify in an HTML document?
options: The base URL for all relative URLs in the document.
The default language for the document.
The character encoding of the document.
The viewport settings for responsive design.
questions.answer: The base URL for all relative URLs in the document.

questions.question: How can you specify the character encoding for an HTML document?
options: By using the `<meta charset='UTF-8'>` tag in the `<head>` section.
By setting the `encoding` attribute on the `<html>` tag.
By defining the character set in the HTTP headers.
By using the `setCharset` JavaScript function.
questions.answer: By using the `<meta charset='UTF-8'>` tag in the `<head>` section.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the `<link rel='stylesheet'>` tag?
options: To link an external CSS stylesheet to the HTML document.
To define internal styles for an element.
To create a hyperlink to another web page.
To embed JavaScript files.
questions.answer: To link an external CSS stylesheet to the HTML document.

questions.question: What does the `async` attribute do when included in a `<script>` tag?
options: It allows the script to be executed asynchronously with the page loading.
It makes the script block the rendering of the page until it's loaded.
It ensures the script runs after the page is fully loaded.
It loads the script from an external source.
questions.answer: It allows the script to be executed asynchronously with the page loading.

questions.question: What does the `<meta name='viewport'>` tag do?
options: It controls the layout of the webpage on mobile browsers.
It defines the character set for the document.
It specifies the document's title.
It links external stylesheets.
questions.answer: It controls the layout of the webpage on mobile browsers.

questions.question: What is the difference between `<section>` and `<div>` elements?
options: `<section>` is semantic and represents a thematic grouping, while `<div>` is a non-semantic container.
Both are the same and can be used interchangeably.
`<div>` is used for grouping sections, while `<section>` is used for inline content.
`<section>` can have attributes, while `<div>` cannot.
questions.answer: `<section>` is semantic and represents a thematic grouping, while `<div>` is a non-semantic container.

questions.question: What does the `<iframe>` element do?
options: It embeds another HTML page within the current page.
It links to an external stylesheet.
It creates a new HTML document.
It defines a form for user input.
questions.answer: It embeds another HTML page within the current page.
